item.source: Adding a go up ladder in ur script?

item.title: Adding a go up ladder in ur script?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

No, you will not need any kind of path/tiles for going up and down a ladder. Get it to the ladder yourself. In the script, make it look for a ladder and then atObject(ladder, action); on it. If you don’t know what I mean, look at a script where it goes up and down ladders, opens doors/gates, etc. They’re all done in the same manner.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a go up ladder in ur script?

item.title: Adding a go up ladder in ur script?
item.dc:creator: @Flat_Line Flat Line
item.description:
@Flat_Line wrote:

im making a script but i need to know how to go from my walking coords to going up a ladder then back, thx:

private static final Tile[] PATH_TEST = new Tile[] {
new Tile(0000, 0000), new Tile(0000, 0000), new Tile(0000, 0000),
ladder
new Tile(0000, 0000), new Tile(0000, 0000), new Tile(0000, 0000),
};

would that work? if so how to i do the ladder part? like atNPC or w/e

ill appriciate all pointers
